channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: More potholes Hanover Street Cheltenham, 24th December
item.description:
Large deep potholes on Hanover Strret by junction with Marle Hill Road. The Hanover Street road surface is in a shocking state. It already has several patches where potholes have been repaired previously. The road needs resurfacing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Marle Hill Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes Hanover Street Cheltenham, 24th December
item.description:
2 deep potholes, each over a foot in diameter opposite 50 Hanover Street. Hanover Street needs resurfacing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 50 Hanover Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Further to this mornings rains .23/12/20 . Gambles Lane was like a river as the water flowing from the main road had no where to go. The 2 off drains on the road . One is blocked and the other is so far to the centre of the road it's usless. Obviously an error on installation. Could we please have the drain unblocked and the second drain positioned so it can actually do something., 23rd December
item.description:
One kerbside drain blocked and the other so far into the road it misses the flow of water .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Gambles End Gambles Lane, Cleeve Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Wooden Packing Stuuf Dumped at Location, 23rd December
item.description:
The location is the Aggs Hill / Cotswold Way Road going towards the Burnt Oak Crossroads - on the right hand side about 20 yards from the crossroads. The material is as previously reported consisting of wooden frames covered with hardboard and likely packaging of some sort from a commercial operation. Please can it be collected as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge deep pothole, 22nd December
item.description:
Pot hole has been there for a while it keeps being refilled and refilled, keeps coming back. however you can’t dodge it as cars are parked opposite unless you mount kerb, as the weather isn’t great at the moment it fills with water and can’t see it... not everyone knows it’s there and you can here cars bang from inside the house from the hole .... sinclair road going in to lambert gardens gl51 4sl
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 42 Lambert Gardens, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple blocked gullies in same road, 20th December
item.description:
Shelburne Road (full length, both sides). Multiple blocked / submerged gullies, especially at the Lansdown Road end along to the pedestrian crossing outside Dean Close School. EVERY gully in the entire road (full length, both sides) need cleaning out, along with full length of ALL gutters cleaning too - loads of leaf mulch not helping the gully situation. Maybe if this work is FULLY done I might believe that reports like this are actually taken seriously and acted upon, rather than just being ignored. But I won't hold my breath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Shelburne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road surface and drainage issues. Will cause accident soon, 18th December
item.description:
Rapid deterioration of the road at bottom of Aggs Hill from top of Harp hill to Birdlip Road entrance. Heavy surface run off when raining, Uneven road surface and chunks missing from Tarmac. Road becoming dangerous and and accident will occur as a result.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gulley emptying, 17th December
item.description:
There are two or possibly three top entry gullies adjacent to the kerb on the roundabout. These are blocked and full of detritus contributing to excess surface water. It would appear they are not on the emptying route sheet as they have never been emptied since the roundabout was constructed in the 1990s
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit 2 Rutherford Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
